moves.3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Nf3: not the usual line but going to Slav defense main line
moves.4... e6 5. Bg5: I like to solve the black bishop issue this way
moves.5... h6 6. Bxf6 Qxf6 7. e3 dxc4: Black decides - I don't want the center
moves.8. Bxc4 b5: Black decides to solve the white bishop issue - but destroying the pawn structure for a suitable place for your bishop?!?
moves.9. Bd3 Nd7 10. Qc2: Semi opened flank - some would say not so good I would say so far so good
moves.10... Bb7 11. Ne4: It is time to send the queen home
moves.11... Qd8 12. O-O: Development part 1 done - next rooks and taking over the center
moves.12... Be7 13. Rfd1: Due to the course of the game it would have been better for the A-flank rook to take this spot but the basic idea is F-rook to D and A-rook to C
moves.13... f5: I once read - don't send a pawn to do the man's work, they can't go back
moves.14. Ng3: Well look at those clumsy knights pinned to the king's pawns - or are they
moves.15. Ne2: Look the way the knights with the pawns control the black center squares - the black pawns can go no further
moves.15... Qc7: X-ray lesson #1 - never leave your queen X-rayed
moves.16. Bxb5 Bd6: I don't care about pawns I am going to mate
moves.17. Bc4: Pointing out the black e6 weakness and more important pointing out the pointless black attack
moves.17... Rae8 18. a3: That black bishop dilemma - I can't mate I can't go anywhere else
moves.18... Nf6: X-ray lesson #2 - never leave your King X-rayyed
moves.19. Qxf5 Nd5 20. Qh3: Although it seems the Queen is cornered it still watches the crucial squares - the week pawn on e6 and defends the knight on f3
moves.20... Rf6 21. e4: as I mentioned before - the black left the center for the white, so it was time to seize it
moves.21... Nf4: well not the best spot, because soon it will be gone and cause the black more problems
moves.22. Nxf4 Rxf4 23. e5: The week e6 pawn determines the faith of the black - there is not good place for the bishop, nor for the rook, the black's pawn structure is gone and the black decides it is enough
